summary: The Federal Firefighters Families First Act aims to improve pay equality and retirement benefits for federal firefighters. It seeks to enhance recruitment and retention by including regularly scheduled overtime in retirement calculations, and to mandate the establishment of a maximum 60-hour workweek through Office of Personnel Management regulations. The bill amends Title 5 of the United States Code, affecting how firefighter compensation and retirement annuities are computed. The changes are intended to take effect 60 days after enactment.
